        public SegmentedJournal.Builder<E> withStorageLevel​(io.atomix.storage.StorageLevel storageLevel)

        Returns:
        The storage builder.

      • withMaxSegmentSize

        public SegmentedJournal.Builder<E> withMaxSegmentSize​(int maxSegmentSize)
        Sets the maximum segment size in bytes, returning the builder for method chaining.

        The maximum segment size dictates when logs should roll over to new segments. As entries are written to a segment of the log, once the size of the segment surpasses the configured maximum segment size, the log will create a new segment and append new entries to that segment.

        By default, the maximum segment size is 1024 * 1024 * 32.

        Parameters:
        maxSegmentSize - The maximum segment size in bytes.
        Returns:
        The storage builder.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the maxSegmentSize is not positive

      • withMaxEntrySize

        public SegmentedJournal.Builder withMaxEntrySize​(int maxEntrySize)
        Sets the maximum entry size in bytes, returning the builder for method chaining.
        Parameters:
        maxEntrySize - the maximum entry size in bytes
        Returns:
        the storage builder
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the maxEntrySize is not positive

      • withMaxEntriesPerSegment

        @Deprecated
public SegmentedJournal.Builder<E> withMaxEntriesPerSegment​(int maxEntriesPerSegment)
        Deprecated. since 3.0.2
        Sets the maximum number of allows entries per segment, returning the builder for method chaining.

        The maximum entry count dictates when logs should roll over to new segments. As entries are written to a segment of the log, if the entry count in that segment meets the configured maximum entry count, the log will create a new segment and append new entries to that segment.

        By default, the maximum entries per segment is 1024 * 1024.

        Parameters:
        maxEntriesPerSegment - The maximum number of entries allowed per segment.
        Returns:
        The storage builder.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the maxEntriesPerSegment not greater than the default max entries per segment

      • withIndexDensity

        public SegmentedJournal.Builder<E> withIndexDensity​(double indexDensity)
        Sets the journal index density.

        The index density is the frequency at which the position of entries written to the journal will be recorded in an in-memory index for faster seeking.

        Parameters:
        indexDensity - the index density
        Returns:
        the journal builder
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the density is not between 0 and 1

      • withCacheSize

        public SegmentedJournal.Builder<E> withCacheSize​(int cacheSize)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the journal builder
        Throws:
